awd_titl_txt: Calibration of the Latest Eocene-Oligocene Geomagnetic      Polarity Record Using Paleomagnetism and 40Ar/39Ar Dating ofIgnimbrite Sequences in New Mexico, Colorado, and Texas
awd_abstract_narration: Published radiometric calibrations of the mid-Tertiary                     magnetic polarity time scale (MPTS) vary in age by as much as                   20%.  PI's will improve this calibration by determining a well-                 dated magnetic polarity record from volcanic sequences in New                   Mexico, Colorado, and Texas, using a combination of paleomagnetic               analyses and high-precision 40 Ar/39 Ar dating of sanidine.                          The combination of precisely dated polarity records from                   these volcanic fields, together with similar data from the San                  Juan volcanic field, will allow development of a single                         integrated polarity record spanning much of latest Eocene and                   Oligocene time.  Although discontinuous, this integrated record                 will offer very precise constraints on the age and duration of                  polarity intervals from several segments of the mid-Tertiary                    MPTS.                                                                                Accurate calibration of the MPTS will tightly constrain mid-               Tertiary sea floor spreading rates and improve correlations                     between marine and terrestrial biostratigraphic records.

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: REU SUPP-Res Exp for Ugrd Supp
